entry.et: Middle English greten, from Old English grētan; akin to Old English grǣtan to weep

def.dt: :to address with expression of kind wishes upon meeting or arrival greeted guests at the door
:to meet or react to in a specified manner greeted him with boos
:to occur as a response to apathy greeted the plan
:to appear to the perception of a surprising sight greeted her eyes

entry.et: Middle English greten, from Old English grǣtan; akin to Old Norse grāta to weep

def.dt: :a reception at which a public figure (as a politician or rock star) socializes with press members and other guests
